instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1466 820 3437 Board No Power , No Chime, No Fan Spin
threads.message:
Power rails measure normal, am getting .46 V on PPVCC_S0_CPU

No visible corrosion but signs of water damage.

Not sure how to diagnose low voltage on this line, how should I proceed?

Thankyou!

threads.title: A1466 820 3437 Board No Power , No Chime, No Fan Spin
threads.message:
Do you get all other normal voltages, excepting CPU core?
Check if U7310/20 are correctly powered and look if R7311/21 and C7311/21 are all good/present.
Also check U7200 area, VR_ON, VIN, VDD.
Is sufficient one corroded small resistor; and there are many, too many...
You may also consider to change the MOSFETs from CPU power supply.

threads.title: A1466 820 3437 Board No Power , No Chime, No Fan Spin
threads.message:
R7311/21 = 4.8V
C7311/21 = 4.8V

U7310 Pin 8 (Phase) is getting the same .46V as PPVCC_S0_CPU

These readings do not match my known good board. Is this a step in the right direction?

threads.title: A1466 820 3437 Board No Power , No Chime, No Fan Spin
threads.message: No use in measuring Vcore if there is not even fan spin. Check all S4/S3 rails first if present then all S0 rails. S0_CPU will be the very last rail to come on and the fan should spin first.
